column1: #Text=We have substituted the trivalent cation Pr3+ at the Tb3+ site of Tb1-xPrxMnO3 for x= 0.4.
#Text=Single-phase Tb0.6Pr0.4MnO3 oxide, as well as the parent compounds i.e.
#Text=TbMnO3 and PrMnO3, have been synthesized by the solid-state synthesis method, using high-purity oxide precursors (≥ 99.9% or better), Tb4O7, MnO2, Pr2O3.
#Text=The oxide precursors were preheated at 150° C for 24 hours, then mixed in proper stoichiometry in an agate mortar and pestle; the mixture was ground for 8 hours.
#Text=Then the mixture was placed in a high-temperature furnace by ‘Metrex’ and calcined at 1300 ˚C for 24 h.
#Text=For homogeneity and single-phase formation, the calcined sample was ground again for 2 hours and pelletized by applying 6-ton pressure for 20 min.
#Text=The pellet was sintered at 1400 ˚C for 24 h, followed by furnace cooling.
#Text=The mentioned parent materials have also been synthesized by solid-state synthesis from the corresponding oxide precursors, using the same procedure.

#Text=The synthesized samples of pure TbMnO3 (TMO), Pr doped Tb0.6Pr0.4MnO3 (TPMO) and PrMnO3 (PMO) have been characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD) to confirm the crystallinity and phase purity, in a Panalytical Empyrean X-ray diffractometer with a step size of 0.02˚ 2θ in the 2θ range from 10˚ - 110˚.
#Text=The XRD patterns of the synthesized samples were further analyzed by the Rietveld refinement technique to evaluate the lattice and structural distortion of TPMO in comparison to TMO and PMO.
#Text=The further study is focused on TPMO.
#Text=For the magnetization study, the temperature-dependent DC magnetization was carried out in the temperature range 5-300 K at 100 Oe, 5000 Oe, 10 kOe using a quantum design SQUID VSM (70 kOe).
#Text=Also, the DC Magnetization study of polycrystalline TPMO sample has been measured as a function of applied magnetic field M(H) (-70 kOe to 70 kOe at different temperatures) by SQUID-VSM (M/s.
